{"step_by_step_thinking": "Enamel prism is a key component of tooth enamel. It is composed of hydroxyapatite crystals arranged in a specific pattern, with a 'head' and a 'tail'. According to scientific studies, the head of the enamel prism is more resistant to demineralization or dissolution than the tail. This is due to the higher mineral content and denser structure of the head compared to the tail.", "answer_choice": "C. Head is more resistant to dissolution"}
